fields.Title of Presentation: Implementing a Substance Use Course into a RNBS Curriculum
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: American Association of Colleges of Nursing (AACN) Faculty Leaders Network Webinars
fields.Sponsoring Organization: American Association of Colleges of Nursing (AACN)
fields.Description/Abstract: This presentation is intended to provide an overview of the integration of substance<br>use content into an RN-BS curriculum. Substance use in the United States increased<br>dramatically during the COVID-19 pandemic and already alarmingly high, 13% of<br>Americans reported beginning or increasing use of substances during this time to<br>cope with pandemic associated stressors. Additionally, opioid deaths increased by<br>30% during this same period of time. Nurses care for patients experiencing substance<br>use disorder (SUD) in every healthcare setting and historically nursing curriculum has<br>not well-prepared students for caring for this vulnerable population. With the<br>increase in substance use, it is important that nurses are equipped with the<br>knowledge to provide care for this vulnerable population.<br><br>Objectives:<br> Discuss the need for substance use education in nursing curricula.<br> Describe the integration and success of a substance use course into RN-BS<br>curriculum.<br> Identify opportunities and resources for incorporating SUD into nursing<br>education.<br> Share strategies on how SUD resources can be used to prepare students to<br>address SUD in practice.<br> Share anonymous student feedback about the value of the course
